subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] we need each other for this,
msgSnippet: ... What for? I d have thought regional distinctions like pin-pen/cot-caught mergers were well documented elsewhere.
messageBody:
On Jul 1, 2013, at 2:45 AM, "Ecclesiastes" <panecclesiastes@...> wrote:

> from those members of this group, recordings where we live and the reading of the index words of the alphabet and then such other words as may demonstrate the local accent, especially letters 32, 33,and 34.
>
> "I am in Biloxi, Mississippi, US."
> "Pea. Bay. Tea. Day. Key. ..."
> "Father. Bother. ..."
>
> For transparency, I think the 32-33-34 series should be collapsed to a single letter, at least for correspondence. I don't know that I *can* hear 34, which is the problem that drives this note
>
> Thank you.
>
> I will be posting my recording shortly.

What for? I'd have thought regional distinctions like pin-pen/cot-caught mergers were well documented elsewhere.
